alert.note: Alert for Doddridge (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 5:15AM EDT until May 07 at 9:10PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following county, Doddridge. * WHEN...Until 515 PM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 515 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to runoff from rainfall. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Union, New Milton, Blandville, Smithburg and Leopold. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
